alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Mesa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 6:53PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding and minor debris flow possible caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Garfield. In west central Colorado, Mesa. * WHEN...Until 845 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 PM MDT, satellite imagery indicate heavy rain from multiple thunderstorms in the advisory area. Minor flooding and debris flows are ongoing or expect to begin shortly. - Eastern half of the Pine Gulch burn scar is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Garfield and North Central Mesa Counties
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
